page.title: 06INDUSTRY
page.content: { GRAVEL EXTRACTION Glacial gravels cover much of the higher land on both sides of the Colne Estuary.Gravel is extracted by mechanical grabs from open pits.It is sorted on the spot through a hopper then via conveyer belts to sorting pits.It is washed and graded into sand for building and gravel of various sizes ranging from 1.5" to 0.375".The larger sizes are bought by British Rail for railway ballast.Smaller gravel and sand is bought and collected by local builders. When a pit is exhausted,the gravel company is legally obliged to restore the land for farming.In the past this was not so,and some old pits are used by angling clubs,such as older pits at Moveron's and for Nature Reserves such as Fingringhoe Wick Reserve on the West bank of the Colne.
